results.title: Target practice: Opportunities for therapeutic intervention in CHIP and CCUS.
results.text_hl: In this review, we outline emerging therapeutic opportunities in @<m>DISEASE_Atypical_Squamous_Cells_of_the_Cervix</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D065309 @@@CCUS@@@, including @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ targets (e.g., @GENE_DFNA34 @GENE_114548 @@@NLRP3@@@, @GENE_IL1B @GENE_3553 @@@IL-1beta@@@, @GENE_IL6 @GENE_3569 @@@IL-6@@@), epigenetic modulators (e.g., hypomethylating agents, @CHEMICAL_Ascorbic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001205 @@@Vitamin C@@@), mutation-specific inhibitors (e.g., @GENE_JAK2 @GENE_3717 @@@JAK2@@@, IDH1/2), and repurposed agents (e.g., statins, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Colchicine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003078 @@@colchicine@@@).

citations.NLM: Mohammad A, Mascarenhas J, Marcellino BK, Nathan DI. Target practice: Opportunities for therapeutic intervention in CHIP and CCUS. Blood Rev. 2025 Jul 25;():101323. PMID: 40731230
citations.BibTeX: @article{40731230, title={Target practice: Opportunities for therapeutic intervention in CHIP and CCUS.}, author={Mohammad A and Mascarenhas J and Marcellino BK and Nathan DI}, journal={Blood Rev}, pages={101323}}

results.title: Effects of Forkhead box O1 on lipopolysaccharide-induced mitochondrial dysfunction in human cervical squamous carcinoma SiHa cells
results.text_hl: Accordingly, enhancing @GENE_FOXO1 @GENE_2308 @@@FOXO1@@@ expression or treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, which protects mitochondrial function, reversed @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@-induced @DISEASE_Mitochondrial_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D028361 @@@mitochondrial dysfunction@@@, cell pyroptosis, migration and proliferation of @<m>DISEASE_Atypical_Squamous_Cells_of_the_Cervix</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D065309 @@@cervical squamous carcinoma@@@ @CELLLINE_CVCL:0032 @@@SiHa@@@ cells.

citations.NLM: Wang H, Ma Z, Gao F, Jiang W, Li Y, Li S. Effects of Forkhead box O1 on lipopolysaccharide-induced mitochondrial dysfunction in human cervical squamous carcinoma SiHa cells Oncol Lett. 2021 Dec;22(6):848. PMID: 34733366

results.title: Caffeic Acid and Metformin Inhibit Invasive Phenotype Induced by TGF-beta1 in C-4I and HTB-35/SiHa Human Cervical Squamous Carcinoma Cells by Acting on Different Molecular Targets
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_caffeic_acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:C040048 @@@Caffeic Acid@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Inhibit Invasive Phenotype Induced by @GENE_TGFB1 @GENE_7040 @@@TGF-beta1@@@ in @CELLLINE_CVCL:2253 @@@C-4I@@@ and @CELLLINE_CVCL:A8FQ @@@HTB-35/@@@@CELLLINE_CVCL:0032 @@@SiHa@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@Human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Atypical_Squamous_Cells_of_the_Cervix</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D065309 @@@Cervical Squamous Carcinoma@@@ Cells by Acting on Different Molecular Targets

results.title: Caffeic Acid Targets AMPK Signaling and Regulates Tricarboxylic Acid Cycle Anaplerosis while Metformin Downregulates HIF-1alpha-Induced Glycolytic Enzymes in Human Cervical Squamous Cell Carcinoma Lines
results.text_hl: The small molecules, natural antioxidant @CHEMICAL_caffeic_acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:C040048 @@@Caffeic Acid@@@ (trans-3,4-Dihydroxycinnamic acid CA) and anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ drug @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (@GENE_SLTM @GENE_79811 @@@Met@@@), activate 5'-adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase (@GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@) and interfere with metabolic reprogramming in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Atypical_Squamous_Cells_of_the_Cervix</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D065309 @@@cervical squamous carcinoma@@@ cells.

citations.NLM: Tyszka-Czochara M, Bukowska-Strakova K, Kocemba-Pilarczyk KA, Majka M. PMID: 29958416
